CheckTitle: HSTS is enabled with recommended max-age to prevent SSL stripping
Description: Verifies that HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) is enabled with a max-age of at least 6 months (15768000 seconds) to instruct browsers to always use HTTPS.
Risk: Without HSTS, browsers may initially connect over HTTP before redirecting to HTTPS, creating a window for SSL stripping attacks where attackers downgrade connections to unencrypted HTTP to intercept traffic.

Recommendation.Text: Enable HSTS with at least a 6-month max-age. Verify all resources work over HTTPS before enabling, then consider HSTS preloading for maximum protection against SSL stripping attacks.

Notes: HSTS requires HTTPS to be properly configured. Ensure all resources are accessible via HTTPS before enabling HSTS with a long max-age.
